creator: Ralph.Henze@spb.de
text:
replaceregexp task doesn't work correctly when using nested fileset tags.

(1) There's a simple bug in line 408 of ReplaceRegExp.java:
    'file.getAbsolutePath()' should be replaced by 'f.getAbsolutePath()'
    in order to not exit with a NullPointerException.

(2) A more serious bug occurs when using nested directories in the 'dir'
    attribute of the nested fileset tag: The set of files that match the 
    'includes' attribute is build correctly, but the absolute path names of
    the files given by the call to 'ds.getIncludedFiles()' are not complete,
    so error messages are thrown out:

    'The following file is missing: foo\bar\blah'

    It seems that nested directories given in the dir-attribute of the fileset
    tag are omitted while building the complete absolute path of the file.
     
    Perhaps it's a bug in the DirectoryScanner class (?!?)

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
this is supposed to be fixed in beta2 - you could try the latest build from here
http://icarus.apache.org/~bodewig/gump/ant1.5beta/ to confirm that it is fixed.
